normalized: somewhere in kantou.
gosha academy.
the government, whose sense of impending danger had grown stronger due to the expansion of the influence of darkness, had secretly constructed a town to house the taimanin and their children.

in this area―which, from the sky, just looked like a mundane provincial town with a lot of greenery, and was effectively a modern-day hidden village―there was an institution that existed for the sake of the early-stage training of outstanding taimanin.
a camouflaged special training institution under direct government control, which operated under thorough infor- mation suppression―that was gosha academy.

four years had now passed since its founding, and gosha academy had steadily continued to raise the young, able forces who would go on to succeed asagi, who served as the commanding officer of the taimanin unit.

normalized: look at that!

name: male student
normalized: the schoolyard!
look at what second years igawa and yatsu are doing!
the school for those beginner taimanin―who, as part of their stealth mission, led lives no different from ordinary students of their generation―was enveloped in unexpected clamour.

name: male student
normalized: oi, let me see too!

name: female student
normalized: they're both amazing…!
the students who had leant out of the window were showering the sports ground with youthful cheers and high-pitched screams.
before the eyes of the students, who had all come together to spectate―even including some of the teachers―were two fighting girls, and a crowd surrounding them.

igawa sakura.
yatsu murasaki.
the pair of young novice kunoichi, who were expected to lead the next generation together, were attending a combat exhibition session, which only began with second-year students.
the zeal of the onlookers―teachers and students who routinely came together to gossip about who was the academy's strongest―was already reaching its peak.

name: murasaki
normalized: haahh!
with her long, blackish-blue hair dancing above a suit with a white colour scheme, murasaki closed the distance from her opponent, huge weapon and all.

name: sakura
normalized: whoa, fast!
with that dainty body, murasaki was easily handling a large axe that weighed more than a grown man.
that was her ability as a taimanin.
in addition to their “anti-demon power”, taimanin were endowed with special abilities, and there was said to be “a ninja art for every shinobi”.

people who went under the ground, people who manipulated fire, people who moved with extraordinary speed… those abilities being unique and diverse, taimanin were a cause of fear for the dwellers of hell.
…however.

name: sakura
normalized: awawa… eeii!
buun…!
having been swung downward, murasaki's large axe cut through the air, and stopped several centimetres above the ground of the schoolyard.
this was not sun-dome―it was an attack with all her strength.
the dangerous blade of the giant axe would cut sakura's body in two, taimanin suit and all.

sakura rushed towards murasaki with short swords in both hands, and dealt a hard blow to murasaki's large axe.

normalized: kuh!
suddenly disappearing from before the eyes of the charging murasaki, and “appearing” at murasaki's chest with her short swords… that took a fraction of an instant.
could sakura's small (but certainly substantial) body somehow dodge the heavy blade, and moreover respond to it with a counterattack?

name: male student
normalized: she did it, shadow-crossing!
the shadow escape arts…!

name: female student
normalized: that girl “slipped” into the shadow that yatsu-san's axe made…?!
the shadow escape arts―that was the name that had been given to sakura's “ninja arts”.
water escape, earth escape… escape arts, which hid one's body by deceiving the eye, were one of the fundamental techniques that had been the forte of shinobi since time immemorial.
however, sakura's ninja ability drew a line between itself and all those other escape arts, in both logic and effect.

ninja arts that let her conceal herself within shadows, which every object was forced to make under the sun, and even allowed her to move from shadow to shadow in an instant―those were sakura's shadow escape arts.

name: sakura
normalized: ――eh, you could see all that just now?
slipping into the shadow of the weapon that swung down towards her, she would move along the shadows and charge into the chest of her opponent…
sakura had readily unleashed her secret shinobi technique, but both her eyes, however, were open wide in astonishment.
it was natural.
was it by chance, or the result of her finely polished martial arts?
with the side of her axe, which she had turned around just before, murasaki was defending against the kodachi that encroached on her body.

name: murasaki
normalized: …tch!
together with her short, fierce breathing, determination filled murasaki's entire body.
again, the large axe was raised overhead.
at the same time, sakura nimbly leapt.

it was a bold counter-charge, with a composed expression, like a noh mask.
but.

a girl's high-pitched voice mixed in with the muffled sound that had expectedly occurred.

sun-dome… it was a training-purpose weapon meant for blocking a blade, but unless murasaki pulled out from swinging the axe, it would have been easy to break sakura's neck.

sakura was the sister of igawa asagi, the commanding officer of the taimanin forces, who worked at gosha academy primarily as a teacher of the combat courses.

based on asagi's desire to keep her sister away from combat, sakura had been going to a normal school until half a year ago, but in the wake of certain incidents, it had been decided that she would officially attend gosha academy and become a taimanin.

the classmates' praise was directed not just toward murasaki, but the defeated sakura as well.
sakura―who had been striving to train independently for some time, aiming to become a taimanin―had stood out conspicuously as soon as she began going to the school.
in particular, it was rumoured that the agility of her body movements had already reached the point of equalling her sister, igawa asagi, who was currently the strongest taimanin.
and murasaki, who had forced that sister of asagi's to yield in a way that one could call overwhelming.
the surrounding pupils were simply astonished by the pair's session, and their abilities.
